contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox musical artist| <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians --> | name = Xiang Xiang<br/>香香 | image = | caption = | image_size = <!-- Only for images smaller than 220 pixels --> | background = solo_singer | birth_name = 王瑾玫 <small>({{zh|p=Wáng Jǐnméi}})</small> | alias = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1984|6|14}} | origin = [[Hunan]], [[People's Republic of China|China]] | instrument = | genre = [[Pop music|Pop]] | occupation = [[Singer]] | years_active = 2004–present | label = | website = [http://www.xxmusic.net/ www.xxmusic.net] }} '''Xiang Xiang''' ({{zh|c=香香|p=Xiāng Xiāng|}}; born June 14, 1984) is reportedly the most popular [[Internet]] [[pop star]] in [[People's Republic of China|China]] of 2005.<ref>{{Cite news| first = Nick | last = Mackie | title = Chinese pop idol thrives online | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/4230846.stm | publisher = [[BBC]] | date = 2005-09-13 | accessdate = 2007-05-31}}</ref> Her birth name is '''Wang Jinmei''' ({{zh|c=王瑾玫|p=Wáng Jǐnméi}}). She is perhaps most famous for her song ''[[Song of Pig]]'' (猪之歌), the title track of [[Song of Pig (album)|her first solo album]]. Xiang Xiang is also known for remaking the song ''[[Mice Love Rice]]'' (老鼠爱大米; Lao Shu Ai Da Mi; by [[Yang Chengang]]), turning it into a hit on the Internet. ==Discography== === Albums === * ''Song of Pig'', February 2005 * ''Xiang Xiang Wang Lu Xiao Gong Zhu Ai Yo Ai Yo Dui Bu Qi'', October 2005 * ''Sorry'', October 2005 * ''Gong Zhu Ri Ji'', December 2005 * ''Healthy Happy Action'', May 2006 * ''Seam Love'', June 2006 * ''Fate New + Best Selection'' ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== <!-- site under construction, no content *{{zh icon}} [http://www.xxmusic.net/ Xiang Xiang official website] --> *{{zh icon}} [http://ok.21cn.com/zhuanti/xiangxiang.html Profile at 21cn.com] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Xiang, Xiang | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Chinese singer | DATE OF BIRTH =1984-06-14 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Xiang, Xiang}} [[Category:1984 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Chinese female singers]] [[Category:People from Changde]] [[Category:Chinese singers]] [[Category:Musicians from Hunan]] {{China-singer-stub}}
